subject: Re: setting up resources once for the entire test cycle?
msgSnippet: ... Another possibility is to use the Daedalos JUnit Extensions that – among other extensions - enable implementing  and controlling (start, stop, reset)
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Yagiz Erkan <yagiz_erkan@y...> wrote:
> > This works, but introducing a BaseTestCase just to store global
> > data is like using a sledgehammer to kill a fly.
>
> :-)
>
> > Since ResourceManager from JUnit-addons is just a big Singleton
> > anyway, you might as well just use their implementation rather
> > than build your own.
>
> My ignorance! I'm not really familiar with the addons so when I
> heard the problem I thought a design twist would do the job.
> Well... If somebody thought about it before, there is no need to
> reinvent the wheel, isn't there?
>
> Have a nice weekend!
>
> > Yagiz

Another possibility is to use the Daedalos JUnit Extensions that

among other extensions - enable implementing and controlling (start,
stop, reset) TestResources easily. With TestResources, you can use
specific resources during the whole test cycle. Furthermore, a
graphical TestResource Browser complements the standard JUnit SwingUI
and allows managing your own TestResources in a very comfortable way.

Greetings,

Jens
